results.headline: Out of Paradise and Into the Pot: A Post-Communism Parable

results.summary_short: “Rabbit à la Berlin,” part nature study and part cold war allegory, examines the human consequences of the Berlin Wall through the startled eyes of wild rabbits.

results.summary_short: Tanna Frederick is the ambitious “Queen of the Lot” in Henry Jaglom’s latest Hollywood satire.

results.summary_short: Tanya Hamilton’s “Night Catches Us” is an exploration of Black Panther militancy, police brutality and the ebbing of the revolutionary intensity of the ’60s.
